properties.Title: Blizzard Warning Ended
properties.Summary:
Description: Though winds remain strong, blizzard conditions are no longer expected. ###

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. Additional Snowfall: 5 to 20 cm, highest amounts in the Makkovik area. Maximum wind gusts: northerly 60 km/h. Locations: the mid Labrador coast from Rigolet to Makkovik. Time span: continuing until this evening. Remarks: The snow will combine with strong northerly winds to produce blowing snow, especially over exposed areas. ### Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Winter storm warnings are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-01-09T01:59:31-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-08T14:49:31-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2399033991.2021
Area: Rigolet and vicinity, Postville - Makkovik
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. A strong frontal system approaching the BC coast is bringing very strong southeasterly winds to the exposed coastal sections of the North Coast and Haida Gwaii. Southeast winds of 100 to 120 km/h have developed and will ease by midday. ### High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-08T21:59:01-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-08T12:44:01-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3244839864.2021
Area: Haida Gwaii, North Coast - coastal sections
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Additional Snowfall: 5 to 10 cm. Location: Upper Lake Melville. Time span: continuing until this afternoon. Remarks: Snow is expected to gradually taper to flurries by late this afternoon. Northerly winds gusting up to 50 km/h may cause reduced visibility in blowing snow over exposed areas at times. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-01-08T22:59:15-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-08T14:49:15-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3610281090.2021
Area: Upper Lake Melville
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. A strong frontal system currently along the BC coast is bringing very strong winds to the exposed coastal sections of the Central Coast. Southeast winds of 90 to 110 km/h will ease by mid morning. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-08T18:59:07-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-08T12:42:07-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2573803892.2021
Area: Central Coast - coastal sections
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Near zero visibility in fog is expected or occurring over some areas. A few large patches of thick fog have developed over southeastern Alberta and are significantly affecting visibility along area highways in particular parts of the Transcanada highway near Gleichen and Bassano. These patches are expected to continue to expand this morning before the sun clears them out early this afternoon. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-08T21:59:04-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-08T17:04:04-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2597640005.2021

properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Locations: Hopedale and vicinity. Time span: continuing until this evening. Remarks: Strong northerly winds gusting between 70 and 80 km/h will combine with 5 to 10 cm of new snow to produce very poor visibility in blowing snow. Conditions will improve by this evening as the snow begins to taper off and winds begin to diminish. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Blowing snow advisories are issued when winds are expected to create blowing snow giving poor visibility to 800 metres or less for at least 3 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-01-09T01:59:23-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-08T14:49:23-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2720639011.2021
Area: Hopedale and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with poor visibility in snow and blowing snow are expected or occurring. Blizzard conditions are expected tonight in Naujaat as an approaching low pressure system brings snow and very strong southerly winds with gusts up to 70 km/h. Winds are expected to ease overnight bringing improved visibility. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-08T18:04:16-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-08T05:35:16-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0398114844.2021
Area: Naujaat
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Southerly winds are reaching near 100 kilometres per hour today. These high winds will last until early this evening. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow combined with strong winds will reduce visibilities to near zero over these areas today. Protect yourself from the wind, the cold and disorientation by staying safely inside. A blizzard warning is issued when winds are expected to produce blowing snow with widespread visibilities of 400 metres or less for at least 6 hours. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-09T05:59:16-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-08T16:23:16-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2106251459.2021
Area: Ivujivik, Salluit
